node.title: Sydney plagued by public transport failures despite billions spent on infrastructure
node.alt: a light rail and a train
node.description: From cracks on trams to trains that are too wide for tunnels, the delivery of public transport services across NSWÂ has been riddled with problems.
node.content:
["Sydney is a city under construction, with the NSW government spending\u00a0billions on public transport infrastructure.", "The Sydney Metro network alone is going to cost upwards of $40 billion by the time it is\u00a0finished, with a trip from Parramatta to the CBD touted to take 20 minutes when the Metro West line is completed in 2030.", "But the delivery and operation of many of these projects \u2014 from trains and trams to ferries \u2014 have been plagued by\u00a0issues.", "The most recent, the decommissioning of the entire inner-west light rail fleet for up to 18 months, is just the latest in a long list of public transport problems.\u00a0", "", "
The Metro West light rail line will connect Parramatta to the Sydney CBD.(Supplied: Artist's impression, Tranpsort for NSW)
", "
Trains too wide for tunnels
", "In 2016, the NSW government purchased a $2.3 billion train fleet to run from Sydney to Newcastle, the Central Coast, South Coast and the Blue Mountains.", "Then-transport minister Andrew Constance said there would be a 25 per cent cost saving from building the Mariyung fleet in South Korea.\u00a0", "But the 3.1-metre double-decker carriages were too big to travel the 75 kilometres from Springwood to Lithgow and the\u00a0tracks had to be realigned, stations modified and tunnels widened.\u00a0", "The initial expectation was the trains would start rolling out two years ago, but a spokesperson for Transport for NSW (TfNSW) said\u00a0the delivery schedule for the fleet had been affected by the order of more carriages in February 2019.", "", "
Train stations had to be modified along the Springwood to Lithgow line to accommodate the bigger trains.(Supplied: Transport for NSW)
", "\"Travel restrictions during 2020 affected the delivery of specialist components and technology, together with access to key equipment and specialist workers,\" they said in a statement.", "\"A timeline for when the trains will start operating on the Blue Mountains and South Coast lines will be determined after more trains are delivered and further testing completed.\"", "
Ferries too high
", "Two new fleets of ferries have been plagued by\u00a0similar size-related problems.", "Ten River Class ferries\u00a0built in Indonesia\u00a0are too high to travel under the Camellia Railway Bridge and Gasworks Bridge on the Parramatta River with passengers sitting on the top deck.\u00a0", "Some were also found to contain asbestos. They will only be able to travel during daylight hours until a design flaw in the glass is fixed to reduce glare in the wheelhouse at night.", "", "
The Indonesian-built River Class ferries are too big for some bridges on the Parramatta River.(Supplied: Transport for NSW)
", "A TfNSW press release last month said the first of the new ferries were in daytime service and the existing fleet would continue to be used until the River Class vessels were available for use at night.", "\"The rest of the fleet will progressively roll out for daytime operations, while work is undertaken to reduce the glare in the wheelhouse at night,\" the press release said.", "The Emerald Class ferries, currently being rolled out on the Circular Quay to Manly route as some of the Freshwater Class boats are retired, are not able to pull up to their usual wharf at Manly in very low tides.", "A spokesperson for the ferry operator Transdev, said in a statement\u00a0about 5 per cent of services were affected and Transdev was looking at options for a new gangway at Manly Wharf 1.", "Meanwhile, in 2018, a new ferry was renamed in honour of children's author May Gibbs, after it was found that its original moniker,\u00a0Ferry McFerryface, was not the winner of a public vote.\u00a0", "", "
The Emerald Class ferries are not able to pull up\u00a0to their usual wharf at Manly in very low tides.(Supplied: Transdev)
", "
Light rail woes
", "The construction of the CBD and South East Light Rail was characterised by a variety of issues, including a lawsuit which saw the NSW government pay $576 million in compensation to Spanish construction company Acciona.\u00a0\u00a0", "It opened nine months late and cost more than $3 billion \u2014 almost double the original budget of $1.6 billion.\u00a0", "The French-made trams operating on this new line are different to the trams on the inner-west line, so they cannot be used to help keep the route running.", "", "
Buses have replaced the suspended Central to Dulwich Hill light rail service.(ABC News: Harriet Tatham)
", "Buses are currently operating in place of the inner-west light rail service, with a half-price discount on fares.", "In 2016, a number of Sydney buses caught fire, causing a major stoush between the Rail, Tram and Bus Union and then-minister Andrew Constance.", "One of the incidents caused hours of delays and the closure of four lanes on\u00a0the Sydney Harbour Bridge.\u00a0", "
Calls for Australian-made infrastructure
", "The New South Wales opposition blames the slew of problems on the government's record of overseas procurement.", "\"The NSW government needs to have faith in our domestic manufacturing and \u2026 stop buying overseas made infrastructure and instead deliver good-quality jobs here and deliver passengers a quality product they can rely on,\" Opposition Transport Spokesperson Jo Haylen said.", "\"Because of the government's failed policies, there are\u00a0no guarantee this won't happen elsewhere in New South Wales.\"", "Transport Minister Rob Stokes has only recently taken on the portfolio following\u00a0Andrew Constance resigning\u00a0from state politics to run for the federal seat of Gilmore at the next election.", "", "
Transport Minister Rob Stokes (centre)\u00a0suspended the inner-west light rail fleet after cracks were found.(ABC News)
", "Mr Stokes said in a statement that in recent procurements, no Australian companies had bid for the contract.", "\"We welcome any Australian company to bid to provide our fleet,\" Mr Stokes said.", "\"We are very proud of our Australian workforce that maintain and service the fleet and who helped identify the issue on the inner west light rail.", "\"Where we can, we do purchase from Australian manufacturers, such as our new Custom Denning buses, who are based in Western Sydney.\""]
